ud5.4:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ud5.4:1.3: Now at that time, between Sāvatthī and the Jeta Grove, several boys were tormenting some fish.
ud5.4:2.1: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Sāvatthī for alms.
ud5.4:2.2: He saw the boys tormenting the fish.
ud5.4:2.3: He went to them and said,
ud5.4:2.4: “Boys, do you fear pain? Do you dislike pain?”
ud5.4:3.1: Then, knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud5.4:5.1: If you should do a bad deed,
ud5.4:5.3: you won’t be freed from suffering,
ud5.4:5.4: though you fly away and flee.”
